body: The juridical form affects the taxation of certain transactions added to the fund portfolios.

title: Create a fund company
body: Classification* (default: Professional)

title: Create a fund company
body: Classification of the fund company.

title: Create a fund company
body: When you create a fund company in the FA Fund management app, the system creates a contact with the specified properties in FA Back to store the fund company information.

title: Create a fund
body: A fund in FA Fund management contains a range of settings for NAV and fee calculation, fund reporting, order execution, income distribution and accounting. To add a fund and define the fund settings:

title: Create a fund
body: Go to FA Fund management, NAV status view.

title: Create a fund
body: Click Add fund in the upper-right corner. The Fund wizard guides you through the fund properties that you need to define. For details, see Fund properties in the Fund wizard.

title: Create a fund
body: FA creates a fund portfolio with the specified properties in FA Back to store the fund information and manage fund subscriptions and redemptions. To open this portfolio in FA Back, click in the Fund details pane on the right.

title: Create a fund
body: After you created a fund, you can add share classes if needed and start the fund. See Add share classes and Start the fund for instructions.

title: Fund properties in the Fund wizard
body: Fund properties in the Fund wizard

title: Basic info tab
body: The Basic info tab contains the basic information about the fund.

title: Basic info tab
body: Fund company*

title: Basic info tab
body: The company the fund is administered by. See Create a fund company.

title: Basic info tab
body: Language*

title: Basic info tab
body: The language to be used in portfolio reports. You can also see the language of the fund in the contact of the company in FA Back.

title: Basic info tab
body: Juridical*

title: Basic info tab
body: Juridical form of the fund company. You can also see the juridical form in the contact of the company in FA Back.

title: Basic info tab
body: Name*

title: Basic info tab
body: Fund name.

title: Basic info tab
body: ID*

title: Basic info tab
body: A unique fund ID used to identify the fund and search for funds. You should only use numbers and letters (a-z).

title: Basic info tab
body: Fund business ID

title: Basic info tab
body: The ID provided by the authorities for your fund. Fund business ID is used for tax reporting purposes. The ID is saved in FA Back. You can find it in the Portfolio window, IDs tab.

title: Basic info tab
body: Inception date

title: Basic info tab
body: The date when the fund starts.

title: Basic info tab
body: Currency*

title: Basic info tab
body: Fund currency. Once you create a fund, the currency can't be changed.

title: Basic info tab
body: Valuation method*

title: Basic info tab
body: Valuation method for the fund portfolio:

title: Basic info tab
body: Average price

title: Basic info tab
body: Average price with adjustments – Uses transaction types that control the market value of the positions with the transaction's trade amount, such as Private Equity transaction types.

title: Basic info tab
body: Average price with separate items – Valuates portfolio with average price, but keeps track of original purchase dates.

title: Basic info tab
body: FIFO

title: Basic info tab
body: FIFO (combined) – Valuates the portfolio based directly on transactions in the subportfolios.

title: Basic info tab
body: FIFO with adjustments – Uses transaction types that control the market value of the positions with the transaction's trade amount, such as Private Equity transaction types.

title: Basic info tab
body: Type*

title: Basic info tab
body: Portfolio type. Choose the type that corresponds to the fund portfolio.

title: Cash accounts
body: Cash accounts for the fund.

title: Cash accounts
body: Name*

title: Cash accounts
body: Account name.

title: Cash accounts
body: Currency*

title: Cash accounts
body: Account currency.

title: Cash accounts
body: Account number*

title: Cash accounts
body: The account number, for example, the bank account number.

title: Cash accounts
body: Set as default account

title: Cash accounts
body: Set the account as the default account of the portfolio. All transactions are by default created against this account.

title: Cash accounts
body: Share to all parent portfolio's subportfolios

title: Cash accounts
body: Make the account available in the parent portfolio and in the other portfolios under the parent portfolio. Choose this option, for example, if you are going to use FX-hedged share classes in your fund. For details, see Hedge currency exposure.

title: Schedules tab
body: The Schedules tab contains schedule settings for calculating NAV, fees, and unofficial NAV for the fund. Schedules let you track your fund's status. For example, you can see if NAV or fees have to be calculated today. You need to fill in the dates only once. After that, dates are updated every time you accept the calculation.

title: Schedules tab
body: The Schedules tab features settings for different workflows. You can set a schedule to calculate:

title: Schedules tab
body: NAV and fees as a part of regular NAV calculation workflow.

title: Schedules tab
body: Fees, in addition to the regular NAV calculation schedule, between the regular NAV calculation dates (to set a schedule for this workflow, click Add separate fee calculation schedule).

title: Schedules tab
body: Performance fee with equalization method (to set a schedule for performance fee equalization, click Add fee crystallization schedule). You can also use the same schedule for fee capitalization if you have chosen it in fee settings on the Fee structure tab.

title: Schedules tab
body: Unofficial NAV for reporting purposes between the scheduled regular NAV calculations (to set a schedule for this workflow, click Add unofficial NAV calculation schedule).

title: Schedules tab
body: To learn more about calculation workflows, see Workflows and NAV statuses.

title: Schedules tab
body: Frequency

title: Schedules tab
body: Calculation frequency: daily, weekly, every two weeks, and so on.

title: Schedules tab
body: If you want to make calculations without a preset schedule, choose "No schedule" and select Allow non-scheduled calculations below. This option is available for NAV, fees, and unofficial NAV calculations.

title: Schedules tab
body: Holiday calendar

title: Schedules tab
body: The holiday calendar to take into account in the calculation schedule. If you don't find a suitable holiday calendar from the list, you can create a calendar in FA Back (for details, see Preference - Securities in the FA Back reference).

title: Schedules tab
body: Roll convention

title: Schedules tab
body: Calculation schedule based on the day of the month or day of the week. One of the most common roll conventions is "EOM" (end-of-month).

title: Schedules tab
body: You set the calculation frequency to "Every three months" and the first calculation date is on June 30th. The calculation dates will fall on the 30th of each month (September 30th, December 30th, March 30th, and so on). For months with 31 days, the calculation date won't be the last day of the month. If you choose the "End of Month (EOM)" roll convention, the system will recognize that June 30th is the last day of the month, and the calculation dates will fall on the last day of each month (September 30th, December 31st, March 31st, and so on).

title: Schedules tab
body: Business day convention

title: Schedules tab
body: Business day convention determines how to adjust a date if it falls on a non-business day.

title: Schedules tab
body: First date

title: Schedules tab
body: The date for which the calculation is made for the first time.

title: Schedules tab
body: Previous date

title: Schedules tab
body: The date for which the latest NAV or fees were calculated. For the newly created fund, previous NAV date must be the same as the first NAV date.

title: Schedules tab
body: Calculation delay in days

title: Schedules tab
body: The number of days between the NAV or fees date and the calculation date. Enter "0" to calculate NAV or fees on the same date, or choose the number of days to calculate NAV or fees with a delay.

title: Schedules tab
body: Calculate next days

title: Schedules tab
body: The button sets the next NAV or fees date and calculation dates according to the information entered above.

title: Schedules tab
body: Next NAV date

title: Schedules tab
body: The next NAV or fees date based on the frequency, holiday calendar conventions and the first NAV or fees date chosen above.

title: Schedules tab
body: Previous calculation date

title: Schedules tab

title: Schedules tab
body: Next calculation date

title: Schedules tab
body: Next calculation date based on the next NAV or fees date and calculation delay.

title: Schedules tab
body: Allow non-scheduled calculations

title: Schedules tab
body: Allows starting a calculation outside the schedule, when the fund has "No action" status. For example, this can be useful in case you don't calculate scheduled NAV often but there are big movements in fund’s capital that affect the valuation of the fund. The Allow non-scheduled calculations option is available for NAV, fees, and unofficial NAV calculations.

title: Schedules tab
body: Non-scheduled NAV calculation result is shown in the NAV window. The calculation date is shown in the Latest NAV column in the NAV status view.

title: Fee structure tab
body: The Fee structure tab lets you set or edit the fees applied to the whole fund. Fund-level fees are calculated first, in the order you place them in the Fund wizard, followed by the share class fees.

title: Fee structure tab
body: To add fees per share class, see Add share classes.

title: Fund fees
body: The Fund fees section lists the fund fees. To add a fee formula, click the Add fee button at the top-right.

title: Fund fees
body: Fee formula

title: Fund fees

title: Fund fees

title: Fund fees

title: Fund fees

title: Fund fees

title: Fund fees

title: Fund fees

title: Fund fees
body: Additional options

title: Fund fees
body: Additional fee setups.

title: Fund fees

title: Fund fees

title: Fund fees

title: Fund fees
body: Use crystallization schedule for capitalization

title: Fund fees
body: Capitalize fees automatically on the crystallization date when you accept NAV. The crystallization dates are defined in the Fund wizard, Schedules tab. Fees are capitalized to the account that has the “Fee capitalization” tag. If no account is marked with this tag, fees are capitalized to the default cash account.

title: Alternative fee calculation modes
body: The Alternative fee calculation modes section contains advanced settings that affect fee handling in the NAV calculation. Leave the selections unticked for regular fee handling.

title: Alternative fee calculation modes
body: Include fees calculated since the previous NAV calculation date in the current NAV calculation (if fees are calculated separately from NAV)

title: Alternative fee calculation modes
body: Take the fees calculated since previous NAV calculation into account when calculating the current NAV.

title: Alternative fee calculation modes
body: Allocate fees per share class from the beginning of the fund (for example, for private equity funds)

title: Alternative fee calculation modes
body: Calculate fees per share class since the beginning of the fund (not since the latest NAV calculation). To learn more, see Calculate and accept NAV.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: The Performance fee equalization section contains the fee formula to use if you calculate performance fee and equalize it regularly according to the crystallization schedule. In addition to choosing the fee formula here, you need to define the crystallization schedule in the Fund wizard, Schedules tab, and the fee parameters in the Share class wizard, Fee structure tab.

title: Fund reporting tab

title: NAV reporting tab

title: NAV reporting tab
body: Enable sending NAV reports by email. You can send NAV reports by email from FA Back (for instructions, see Send documents via email). We recommend that your administrator schedules the report sending in Tools → Administer → Scheduled functions in FA Back. For example, you can have the emails sent out every afternoon on the days when you calculate NAV.

title: Order execution tab

body: Cut-off time

title: Order execution tab

After you set the cut-off time, use decision tables make sure that certain transactions or trade orders that come after the cut-off time don't affect the NAV calculation. To learn more, see Set the cut-off time in FA User guide.

title: Accounting tab
body: The Accounting tab lets you define accounts and rules for generating postings for income distribution (for other income distribution settings, see Income distribution tab .

title: Accounting tab
body: Automated deferral runs before NAV calculation

title: Accounting tab
body: Settings for deferral runs before NAV calculation. You need to run deferrals to generate postings for the income distribution calculation.

title: Accounting tab
body: Choose the deferral type to run and the previous deferral date. If the previous deferral date is empty, the starting date of the fund is used.

title: Accounting tab
body: Accounting rules for income distribution-related postings

title: Accounting tab
body: Accounting rules that are used to generate postings related to income distribution. These rules are specified in the system configuration made by FA consultants. Enter them in the Accounting rules for income distribution-related postings field to change posting status to “Reported” when you accept NAV.

title: Income distribution tab
body: The Income distribution tab features settings for keeping track of the fund's accrued income and calculating the tax on it if needed. FA Fund Management app calculates the accrued income based on the bookkeeping postings and records the result into your fund every time you calculate NAV. You can choose to calculate tax on the accrued income at the same time.

title: Income distribution tab
body: After NAV is calculated, the system creates transactions for accrued income and calculated tax. The calculation also allocates accrued income per share class in security market data (Security window, Market data tab in FA Back) while pricing the share classes with NAV.

title: Income distribution tab
body: Click Enable income distribution and fill in the fields.

title: Accrued income
body: Settings to calculate accrued income.

title: Accrued income
body: Accrued income formula

title: Accrued income
body: Fee formula to calculate accrued income. Accrued income is calculated every time you calculate NAV.

title: Accrued income
body: Fee formula can be specified either for the whole fund or for a share class (not for both). Make sure that you don’t have any fee formulas in the Share class wizard, Fee structure tab if you use fund-level rules and the other way round.

title: Accrued income
body: Transaction type

title: Accrued income
body: Type of the transaction generated by the accrued income formula.

title: Accrued income
body: Bookkeeping accounts used to calculate income distribution

title: Accrued income
body: Fields for bookkeeping accounts to track accrued income. When you calculate NAV, FA sums up the balances on the specified bookkeeping accounts on the NAV date. To enter multiple account numbers, separate them with a semicolon. To include only part of the account balance in the calculation, enter a percentage after the account number. For example, "123456=45,5" means that 45,5% of the 123456 account balance is used in the calculation.

title: Accrued income
body: Mark all “Ready” bookkeeping postings from start of the year to the NAV date as “Reported” when NAV is accepted

title: Advanced settings tab
body: The Advanced settings tab contains miscellaneous settings for your fund.

title: Unit certificates
body: Setting for unit certificates. To learn more about unit certificates in the FA Fund management app, see the Unit certificate

title: Unit certificates

title: Unit certificates

title: Unit certificates
body: Transaction types

title: Pricing of share class without shareholders
body: Define how the unit price for newly created share classes with no shareholders is set:

title: Pricing of share class without shareholders
body: Select the checkbox to use the previous price of the share class.

title: Pricing of share class without shareholders
body: Leave the checkbox empty to use the price from the share class with a higher priority.

title: Allocation
body: Define the setting for updating the share class security allocations.

title: Allocation
body: Update fund security allocations automatically when accepting NAV

title: Allocation
body: The option to update allocations for the share class securities when you accept NAV. You can view allocations in the Security window, Allocations tab in FA Back.

title: Allocation
body: Update allocations for securities that get price from share classes

title: Allocation
body: The option to update allocations for securities that get prices from share classes. For example, such structure with multiple securities can be used, if your fund shares are sold via a nominee. In this case, the share class ownership is handled with two securities:

title: Allocation
body: Share class security that is automatically created in FA Back when you add a share class. This security has the nominee as a shareholder.

title: Allocation
body: Security that has the same prices as the share class security and is owned by end clients. This security is used to get share class positions in clients' portfolios. To link this security to the share class security, open it in FA Back and choose the share class security in the Price from security field.

title: Allocation
body: Choose Update allocations for all securities that get price from share classes to have allocations updated for all securities.

title: Allocation
body: Allocation groups

title: Allocation
body: Allocation groups to update share class allocations based on fund portfolio contents when you accept NAV. Allocations are updated for the configured group(s), based on the fund portfolio’s allocations on the NAV date.

title: Add share classes
body: Once you set up your fund, you can add share classes:

title: Add share classes
body: Go to NAV status view and select the fund.

title: Add share classes
body: Click the Add share class  icon in the Fund details pane on the right. The Share class wizard guides you through the share class properties that you need to define. For details, see Share class properties in the Share class wizard.

title: Add share classes
body: When you create a share class in the Fund Management app, the system creates a share class security with the specified properties in FA Back.

title: Add share classes
body: After you added share classes, you can start the fund. See Start the fund for instructions.

title: Share class properties in the Share class wizard
body: Share class properties in the Share class wizard

title: Basic info tab
body: Share class details and NAV calculation settings.

title: Basic info tab
body: Name*

title: Basic info tab
body: Name of the share class security.

title: Basic info tab
body: Code*

title: Basic info tab
body: A unique code defined for the share class. The code is used to identify the share class security and search for securities in the system. We recommend using numbers and letters (a-z) and avoiding special characters in the security code.

title: Basic info tab
body: ISIN

title: Basic info tab
body: The ISIN code of the share class security.

title: Basic info tab
body: Type*

title: Basic info tab
body: Share class security type. Choose the type that is configured for funds in Preferences. If you have standard solution configuration, use Collective investment vehicles type.

title: Basic info tab
body: Holiday calendar*

title: Basic info tab
body: A holiday calendar that determines business days and holidays in the market to set a settlement date for subscriptions and redemptions. Holiday calendar options are configured in Preferences. You can also set the default holiday calendar used for new securities in Preferences.

title: Basic info tab
body: Share class priority

title: Basic info tab
body: The order in which share class NAVs are calculated if there are multiple share classes. The NAV for the share class with the highest priority is calculated first.

title: Basic info tab
body: Decimal count for transaction units

title: Basic info tab
body: Number of decimals used in the units field of the client transactions. If the field is empty, the number of decimals set for the security type is used.

title: Basic info tab
body: Enable dividend payments

title: Basic info tab
body: Enable dividend payments for the share class. You can calculate and execute dividends in the Dividends view. For details, see Pay out fund dividends.

title: NAV tab
body: Unit price settings:

title: NAV tab
body: Currency

title: NAV tab
body: Share class currency – the currency share class units are quoted in.

title: NAV tab
body: Initial price

title: NAV tab
body: (Set for a new share class). Initial price of the share class unit. Initial unit price is used for the first NAV calculation. The price you enter is copied to the Market data info tab in the Security window in FA Back.

title: NAV tab
body: Date of initial price

title: NAV tab
body: (Set when you create a share class). The date for which the initial unit price is valid.

title: NAV tab
body: Format

title: NAV tab
body: Unit price multipliers to use in calculations. For more information about multipliers, see the description of the Basic info tab in the Security window. Choose one of the options:

title: NAV tab
body: Show price as is – Show the share class unit price without any multipliers.

title: NAV tab
body: In percentage – Use "100" in both Multiplier fields for the security.

title: NAV tab
body: Add manually – Enter the multipliers in the fields below.

title: NAV tab
body: Decimals for share class NAV

title: NAV tab
body: The number of decimals used in the share class NAV. If the field is empty, NAV is stored with 10 decimals.

title: Fee structure tab
body: The Fee structure tab defines costs and fees applied on the share class level. Share class-level fees are calculated after the fund level fees, in the order you put them in the Share class wizard. Click Add fee and enter the information about the share class fees:

title: Fund fees
body: Fund fees

title: Fund fees
body: Fee formula

title: Fund fees
body: Fee formula used to calculate the fee and generate fee transaction.

title: Fund fees
body: Fee transaction type

title: Fund fees

title: Fund fees

title: Fund fees
body: Fee percentage or amount in the fund currency, depending on the fee formula.

title: Fund fees
body: Decimals

title: Fund fees
body: The number of decimals used for calculating fees (0 to 10). The “Default” value is 2 decimals.

title: Fund fees
body: Ex-post cost category

title: Fund fees
body: Ex-post cost category for the fee. The categorization is used in cost analysis and reporting (see View ex-post costs and charges in FA User guide), as well as for creating kickbacks (see Rebate contracts (kickbacks) in FA User guide).

title: Fund fees
body: Account currency

title: Fund fees
body: The currency of the share class fee accrual account. Choose if the fees should be accrued in the fund currency or in the share class currency. The field is shown only if the share class currency is different from the fund currency.

title: Fund fees
body: Additional options

title: Fund fees
body: Additional fee setups.

title: Fund fees
body: Formula sets the transaction account

title: Fund fees
body: Set an account for the fee formula. For example, this can be useful with accrued account interest transactions over multiple accounts.

title: Fund fees
body: Include in income distribution

title: Fund fees
body: Include the fee in the income distribution calculation.

title: Fund fees
body: Use crystallization schedule for capitalization

title: Fund fees
body: Capitalize fees automatically on the crystallization date when you accept NAV. The crystallization dates are defined in the Fee crystallization schedule (Fund wizard, Schedules tab). Fees are capitalized to the account that has “Fee capitalization” tag. If no account is marked with this tag, fees are capitalized to the default cash account.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: The Performance fee equalization section contains parameters to calculate and equalize performance fee. Choose the fee parameters. Then, define the crystallization schedule in the Fund wizard, Schedules tab, and the fee formula in the Fund wizard, Fee structure tab.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Fee percentage

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Fee percentage to calculate the fee amount.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Hurdle rate

title: Performance fee equalization
body: The minimum NAV increase above HWM starting from which the performance fee is paid.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Day count

title: Performance fee equalization
body: Day count convention to use in performance fee calculation with hurdle rate. If the calculation period is less than a year, the hurdle rate is adjusted proportionally using the day count convention you chose.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: High-water mark

title: Performance fee equalization
body: The initial high water mark (HWM) to use for the performance fee calculation. Usually, HWM is set to the highest NAV value in the share class. On the crystallization date, FA Fund Management compares the share class NAV to the HWM. If NAV is higher than HWM, the HWM value is updated to the current NAV value.

title: Performance fee equalization
body: High-water mark date

title: Performance fee equalization
body: The date on which high-water mark is set.

title: Transaction fees
body: The Transaction fees section contains parameters for subscription and redemption fees and charging them automatically when you calculate NAV. Enter the subscription and redemption fee parameters:

title: Transaction fees

title: Cash transactions tab
body: Account settings to handle deposits and withdrawals.

title: Cash transactions tab
body: Account

title: Cash transactions tab

title: Tax reporting tab
body: Settings for the Finnish tax reporting: fund company business ID and fund business ID.

title: FX hedging tab
body: FX hedging settings to apply if your share class currency is different from the fund currency and you want to use FX hedging to neutralize the effect of the exchange rate. Click Enable FX hedging and fill in the fields. For full instruction on how to set up and manage FX-hedged share classes, see Hedge currency exposure in FA User guide.

title: FX hedging tab
body: Formula

title: FX hedging tab
body: The formula for the FX hedge accrual. You can choose the "FX hedge formula" that comes pre-configured in Standard solution.

title: FX hedging tab
body: FX hedge transaction type

body: Transaction type linked to the FX hedging formula.

title: FX hedging tab
body: Hedge parent portfolio

title: FX hedging tab
body: ID and portfolio type of the hedge parent portfolio that links fund and hedge portfolios in FA Back. The hedge parent portfolio is empty. It is used to group the fund and hedge portfolios and share accounts between them. You can edit the hedge parent portfolio properties only when you enable hedging for one of the fund share classes for the first time. After that, hedge parent portfolio is set and can't be edited.

title: FX hedging tab
body: Hedge portfolio

title: FX hedging tab
body: ID and portfolio type of the hedge portfolio that contains FX contracts in FA Back. You can edit the hedge portfolio properties only when you enable hedging for a share class. After that, the hedge portfolio is set and can't be edited.

title: Start the fund
body: After you created a fund company, fund and share classes, you can enter the initial fund subscriptions and start the fund. When you start the fund, subscriptions are added to the fund assets, so that you can calculate NAV.

title: Start the fund
body: You can choose how you enter initial fund subscriptions in the system:

title: Start the fund
body: Collect initial subscriptions for the fund as trade orders before you start the fund. When you start the fund, FA system executes trade orders and creates subscription transactions from trade orders.

title: Start the fund
body: Enter initial subscriptions for the fund as transactions when the fund starts.

title: Start the fund
body: In both cases, the system sums up subscriptions and creates a consolidated deposit transaction to the fund portfolio, to include it in the NAV calculation later.

title: Start the fund
body: To handle initial subscriptions and start the fund:

title: Start the fund
body: Create trade orders or subscription transactions in FA Back. Go to New → New trade order → Collective investment vehicles or New → New transaction → Collective investment vehicles in FA Back and fill in the fields:

title: Start the fund
body: Portfolio – Portfolio of the client who subscribes to the fund.

title: Start the fund
body: Security – Fund share class.

title: Start the fund
body: Account – The account from which the payment is made.

title: Start the fund
body: Transaction date, Settlement date – Transaction date and settlement date. These dates must be later than the date of the initial price you set for the share class.

title: Start the fund
body: Transaction type – Transaction type: Subscription (SUB).

title: Start the fund
body: Amount – The number of fund units.

title: Start the fund
body: Unit price – Share class until price. You can leave the field empty (the price will be filled in automatically based on the share class settings) or enter "?" to fetch the price that you set in the Share class wizard.

title: Start the fund
body: Before you start the fund, make sure you set relevant transaction fee for subscriptions in the Share class settings. For example, you can execute first fund subscriptions without a transaction fee and add it later in the share class settings if needed.

title: Start the fund
body: Start the fund on the fund inception date. Choose the fund in the NAV status view and click Start fund in the Fund details pane on the right.

title: Start the fund
body: Now your fund is started. You can proceed with the regular NAV calculation and acceptance workflow: Calculate and accept NAV

title: Apply swing pricing
body: FA Fund Management app lets you calculate swing adjustment for the NAV. Swing pricing is designed to protect existing investors in a fund from the costs incurred when other investors buy or sell units in that fund. NAV per unit is adjusted with the swing factor (in percentage) when net cash flow exceeds the defined thresholds:

title: Apply swing pricing
body: If positive net cash flow exceeds the threshold, NAV is swung upwards:

title: Set up swing pricing
body: To set up swing pricing:

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Choose the fund in the NAV status view and click to open the Fund wizard.

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Go to the Swing pricing tab and choose Apply swing pricing.

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Fill in the fields:

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Official NAV

title: Set up swing pricing
body: A setting to choose how swing adjustment is used in your fund. Choose one of the options:

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Swung NAV - Swing adjustment is included in official NAV. The logic of handling swing adjustment is shown in the table.

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Unswung NAV – Swing adjustment is not included in official NAV. The logic of handling swing adjustment is shown in the table.

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Swing factor

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Swing factor is used for adjusting the unit price.

title: Set up swing pricing
body: For swinging up – The percentage to adjust the unit price if the net inflow of the fund exceeds the threshold.

title: Set up swing pricing
body: For swinging down – The percentage to adjust the unit price if the net outflow of the fund exceeds the threshold.

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Thresholds

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Swing thresholds are the net inflow or net outflow of the fund that triggers the adjustment to the NAV. You can set a threshold in fund currency or as a percentage of the fund's total net asset value on the NAV date.

title: Set up swing pricing
body: For swinging up – Net inflow that triggers swinging up.

title: Set up swing pricing
body: For swinging down – Net outflow that triggers swinging down.

title: Calculate swing adjustment
body: Swing adjustment is calculated automatically when you calculate NAV. Depending on your settings, it can be included in NAV or calculated separately and not included in the NAV you publish. To view the NAV and Unswung NAV/Swung NAV, open the NAV window, Share classes tab.

title: Calculate swing adjustment
body: In FA Back, NAV and Unswung NAV/Swung NAV are shown in the Security window, Market data info tab.

title: Calculate swing adjustment
body: Close 4 field shows NAV in the fund’s base currency depending on swing pricing settings for the fund:

title: Calculate swing adjustment
body: Unswung NAV, if you choose swung NAV as official NAV.

title: Calculate swing adjustment
body: Swung NAV, if you choose unswung NAV as official NAV.

title: Fund reporting data
body: FA Fund management provides you with fund performance-related data that you can use to produce fund factsheets and reports.:

title: Fund reporting data
body: Portfolio content grouped by asset classes and types, showing the market value, share of total and share of parent.

title: Fund reporting data
body: Share class performance, showing TWR, Alpha, Beta, Tracking error, Vol ann, Information ratio, SRRI.

title: Fund reporting data
body: Fund performance, showing TWR, Alpha, Beta, Tracking error, Vol ann, Information ratio, Turnover.

title: Fund reporting data
body: The data is generated regularly acording to the schedule you set up for the fund. When the data is calculated, you can preview and accept it.

title: Fund reporting data
body: To create reports based on the generated data, you need to build a report template. To learn more, see the Reporting section in FA Developer guide.

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: To generate fund reporting data:

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: Set the schedule for calculation the reporting data. To do this, choose the fund in the NAV status view and click to open the Fund wizard. Go to the Fund reporting tab, enable fund reporting and define the schedule. For the field details, see Create a fund.

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: Calculate the reporting data (make sure your fund is in the "Pending" status). You can mass-calculate the data or start the calculations one by one from the side panel in the Fund reporting view.

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: View and check the reporting data. After the calculation is completed, you can preview the data by clicking the fund in the list. For details about the fugures, see Fund reporting data in the Reporting data window.

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: If you notice any mistake in the underlying data that caused incorrect calculation, make the necessary fixes and click Recalculate.

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: If you calculated the reporting data on the wrong date, for example, due to an incorrect schedule, you can delete the calculation data from the system. Double-click the fund in the list and click Delete calculation.

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: Accept the calculation if the data is correct (click Accept).

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: You can track the reporting data calculation status in the Fund reporting view and see if you need to calculate the reporting data today.

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Fund reporting can have the following statuses:

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: No schedule

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: The calculation schedule is missing in the fund settings.

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: No action

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: No calculation or acceptance needs to be carried out today. All calculations are scheduled for the future.

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Pending

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Reporting data needs to be calculated today. If you didn’t calculate the reporting data for the previous scheduled days, you need to calculate and accept these first to be able to calculate the current day’s reporting data.

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Calculated

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Reporting data was already calculated, and you can accept it.

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Accepted

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Reporting data was accepted today. The next calculation date is in the future.

title: Fund reporting data in the Reporting data window
body: Reporting data window shows the reporting data you calculated. The date in the top-right corner shows the latest calculation date. You can choose a previous date to view the history.

title: KPI tabs
body: KPI tabs

title: KPI tabs
body: KPI tabs show fund portfolio analyzed as a whole and by share class. The indicators are:

title: KPI tabs
body: For the fund portfolio: TWR, Alpha, Beta, Tracking error, Vol ann, Information ratio, Turnover.

title: KPI tabs
body: For the share classes: TWR, Alpha, Beta, Tracking error, Vol ann, Information ratio, SRRI.

title: KPI tabs
body: To learn more about these indicators, see Analytics+ in the FA Back reference.

title: Holdings tab
body: Holdings tab

title: Holdings tab
body: The Holdings tab shows the fund portfolio content, with Market value and Share of total specified for each position.

title: Allocation: Asset classes tab
body: Allocation: Asset classes tab

title: Allocation: Asset classes tab
body: The tab shows fund portfolio analyzed by asset type and asset class for all allocation groups.

title: Performance tab
body: Performance tab

title: Performance tab
body: The Performance tab shows the fund portfolio performance since the fund inception as a graph.

title: Set up data sources
body: Reconciliation data is uploaded in FA Operations in a file. You can have multiple data sources for reconciliation, for example, if you reconcile positions and cash accounts, or if you receive position information from different custodians.

title: Set up data sources
body: To make external data available in FA Operations, you need to complete the following steps:

title: Set up data sources
body: If you want to reconcile data by custodian and skip extra positions that are present in FA portfolios but are missing in the external data, you need to tag your portfolios in FA Back. For details, see Reconcile a portfolio in FA User guide.

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: To fetch reconciliation data to FA system, you have the following options, depending on the custodian and the data they provide:

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: Use FA standard integrations. Currently, only DNB Bank and custody connection works with FA Operations out of the box. For details, see Bank and custody connections.

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: Upload the file yourself. To do this, you need to consider the following:

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: File format. If the files you receive from your counterparty are in one of the supported formats, FA system reads them as is. If the file format is unsupported, you need to create a mapping. Supported formats are:

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: MT535

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: FA reconciliation file format (see Create a reconciliation file).

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: File upload. To import the data in FA, you need to upload it in the respective FA folder manually or build a Camel route that fetches the file automatically.

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: For details about file mapping and file upload, see Import custom CSV files to FA.

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: If you already use the reconciliation feature in FA Back, you can use your existing integration. Make sure it delivers files to one of the standard file locations {{back.writable.dir}}/reconciliation/standard/ or {{back.writable.dir}}/reconciliation/settlementDate/.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: To set up the data source:

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Open the Data sources view in FA Operations and click Add data source.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Fill in the fields and define the data fetching options:

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Data source name

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The name of the data source. The data source name is visible in the Reconciliation overview.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Data source code

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The code used to identify the data source. The data source code must match the name of the FA folder where the reconciliation file is uploaded. For example, if your reconciliation folder is .../nordea, the code must be "nordea". If you want to switch from carrying out reconciliation in FA Back from FA Operations, enter "default" as the data source code.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Match portfolios by

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The portfolio property used to match portfolios from FA with the external data source. Choose one of the options: Short name, External ID, Name, Book entry.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Match securities by

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The security property used to match securities from FA with the external data source. Choose one of the options depending on the identifiers you use: ISIN code, Security code, Trade code, Update code 1-3, Name.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Data delivery schedule

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The schedule for fetching the external data to FA Operations. Define the frequency, date and time or enter the Cron expression in the advanced mode.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Use settled balances

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Compare only settled account balances.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Include subportfolios

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Include positions and cash accounts from subportfolios in the reconciliation.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Reconcile items not in the source data

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Identify mismatches if FA positions are missing in the external reconciliation file. If you receive position information from different custodians, turn off this setting to skip the positions missing in the custodian's file.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Date adjustment for data delivery

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The delay in receiving the reconciliation data. For example, if the reconciliation file received today contains the data for the previous day, set the date adjustment as "1". If the file is received on the same day, set the date adjustment as "0".

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Time zone

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Time zone used in the data delivery schedule.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Holiday calendar

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: A holiday calendar to take into account in the data delivery schedule, for example, a weekend calendar with Sat/Sun weekends. The list of available holiday calendars is configured in FA Back (see Preference - Securities).

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Click Save.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: After you set up the data source, it is shown in the Reconciliation overview, Upcoming reconciliations. You can view the reconciliation items when FA Operations receives external data.

title: View reconciliations
body: You can view reconciled positions and cash accounts in the Reconciliation overview:

title: View reconciliations
body: Assigned to me – The summary of reconciliation items assigned to you.

title: View reconciliations
body: Open reconciliations – The list of open reconciliations and summary of all reconciliation items.

title: View reconciliations
body: Upcoming reconciliations – Upcoming reconciliation data that is going to be received by the system according to the schedule.

title: Open reconciliations and view items
body: You can view all open items or the list of items per reconciliation. Use filters , and then sort the content by clicking on column titles. You can save the view you created to open it again later (click ). To manage saved views, click .

title: Open reconciliations and view items
body: For the column descriptions, see Reconciliation item properties.

title: Open reconciliations and view items
body: To view a reconciliation item, click . For the field descriptions, see Reconciliation item properties.

title: Reconciliation item properties
body: You can see the reconciliation item properties in the list of items and in the item details pane that opens on the right.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Reconciliation information includes the details of the reconciliation process:

title: Reconciliation information
body: Type

title: Reconciliation information
body: The type of the reconciliation item: position or cash account.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Status

title: Reconciliation information
body: The reconciliation result:

title: Reconciliation information
body: Match – The data in the source and in the system are the same.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Mismatch – The data in the source differs from the data in the system: the item is missing in the source or in the system or one of the amounts doesn't match.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Fixed – The reconciliation item was fixed by correcting the system value or marked as solved.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Not processed – The item reconciliation is in progress.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Errors

title: Reconciliation information
body: The mismatch details. The list of errors: Missing source data, Missing system data, Mismatch in amount, Mismatch in market trade amount in security currency, Mismatch in market trade amount in portfolio currency, Mismatch in purchase trade amount in security currency, Mismatch in purchase trade amount in portfolio currency.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Assignee

title: Reconciliation information
body: The assignee of the mismatch.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Comment

title: Reconciliation information
body: Comment on the mismatch.

title: Position or cash account details
body: Position and cash account details show the system information about portfolios, securities, and transactions related to the item in the FA system.

title: Position or cash account details
body: Account

title: Position or cash account details
body: Account information for cash balance items. Account details include Source account ID and the details of the matching account in the FA system: System account ID, System account number, System account number 2 (secondary), System account name and Balance.

title: Position or cash account details
body: The item details show all accounts with the matching number found in the FA system. To open the account portfolio in FA Back, click .

title: Position or cash account details
body: Portfolio

title: Position or cash account details
body: The portfolio that contains the position or cash account in the FA system. Portfolio details include Source portfolio ID and the details of the matching portfolio in the FA system: System portfolio ID, System portfolio external IDs, System portfolio name, Short name, Book entry.

title: Position or cash account details
body: If a cash account is used in multiple portfolios in the FA system, you can view the list of portfolios in the item details. The amounts from all portfolios are summed up.

title: Position or cash account details
body: To open the portfolio in FA Back, open the item details and click in the System portfolios section.

title: Position or cash account details
body: Security

title: Position or cash account details
body: The security of the portfolio position in the FA system. Security details include Source security ID and the details of the matching security in the FA system: System security code, System security ISIN, System security name, Trade code, Update codes.

title: Position or cash account details
body: Transactions

title: Position or cash account details
body: Five latest transactions for the reconciliation item based on transaction or settlement date, depending on the configuration (see Set up data sources).

title: Values
body: You can view the reconciled position or cash account values:

title: Values
body: Position: amount, market trade amount in security currency, market trade amount in portfolio currency, purchase trade amount in security currency, purchase trade amount in portfolio currency.

title: Values
body: Cash account: amount (account balance).

title: Values
body: FA Operations shows the following information about the reconciled values:

title: Values
body: System value

title: Values
body: Position amount or account balance in the system.

title: Values
body: Source value

title: Values
body: Position amount or account balance in the external source.

title: Values
body: Difference

title: Values
body: The difference between the source and system value (amount).

title: Values
body: Difference (%)

title: Values
body: The difference between the source and system in percent.

title: About FA Advisor
body: FA Advisor app provides advisors with tools for managing customer-related tasks for existing customers and onboarding new customers.

title: About FA Advisor
body: You can use FA Advisor to do the following:

title: About FA Advisor
body: View and edit customer information. You can see a list of all customers and select an individual customer to view their details.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Manage customer-related notes and documents.

title: About FA Advisor
body: View and manage tasks related to a customer. For example, tasks can be reminders to call the customer at a specific time.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Onboard new customers.

title: About FA Advisor
body: View a customer's investments in FA Client Portal with access to the same view as the customer but without the ability to make modifications.

title: Work with customers
body: In FA Advisor, you can see an overview of all of your customers and select individual customers from the list to see more detailed information about them.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The following information is available as columns or fields in FA Advisor:

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Customer ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: A unique ID defined for a customer in FA Back. The customer ID separates a customer from other customers (the system does not allow more than one customer with the same customer ID). Customer ID cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact ID in Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: External ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The customer’s ID in an external system, for example, identity number or social security number. The external ID can be used to set up client authentication in FA.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Customer type

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Contact type specified in FA Back. Customer type cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window, Type field).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Name

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The name of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Status

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The status of the customer record in the system. Customer status cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Representatives

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Advisor or asset manager who represents the customer. Representatives cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit the representatives in FA Back (Representatives tab in Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Classification

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The trading classification of the customer, for example, professional or non-professional. Classification cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Juridical form

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The juridical form of the customer, for example, private person or company. Juridical form cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Language

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The language to produce reports for the customer. If no language is selected, the reports are printed out in Finnish. Language cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Nationality

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The nationality of the customer. Nationality cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Taxation country

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The taxation country of the customer. Taxation country cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Tags

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Tags assigned to the customer in the system. Tags are used, for example, to set up access to customer portfolios, manage trade orders, or produce reports. Tags cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit them in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Phone numbers 1 and 2

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The customer's phone numbers.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Email

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The email address of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Address (Address 1, Address 2, Postal code, City, Country)

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The customer’s address information.

title: View and edit customer information
body: The Customers view provides an overview of all of your customers as a list. From this view, you can access the details of individual customers as well as open their FA Client Portal profile.

title: View all your customers as a list
body: To see all your customers in a list, open the Customers view. You can search and filter this list and choose to show or hide certain columns, giving you control of the amount of information shown. The Customers view allows you to do the following:

title: View all your customers as a list
body: Show or hide columns. Click Columns and toggle the switches next to each column.

title: View all your customers as a list
body: Filter the list. Click Filters and choose the filtering options.

title: View all your customers as a list
body: Save a view with selected filters and columns. Click Save view. You can set the view as the default view if needed. To open a previously saved view, click Select view and choose a view from the dropdown menu. To see all saved views and edit them, click .

title: View all your customers as a list
body: Export the search results.You can print the list of customer information or export it as a CSV file by clicking the Export button.

title: View all your customers as a list
body: SCREENSHOT OF CUSTOMERS VIEW

title: View customer details
body: To open Customer details, click in the Actions column. The Customer details view allows you to do the following:

title: View customer details
body: View and edit customer information. Click Edit to make changes to the customer's information. See Customer information in FA Advisor for more field information.

title: View customer details
body: View the customer's representatives and representees. To view the customer's representatives, click Represented by, and to view their representees, click Represents. You can see the representative or representee names and the possible tags assigned to them. The tags indicate their relationship with the customer and what permissions they have. To view a representative's or representee's details in FA Advisor, click on the name or on on the right side of the name. You can only edit the representatives or representees in FA Back (Representatives tab in Contact window).

title: View customer details
body: View the customer's investments as a pie chart or a table in the Investments section. You can see each portfolio's name, ID, and total value next to the chart. The chart only shows active portfolios. If the customer has more than 10 portfolios, only 10 are displayed in the pie chart with the smallest portfolios grouped. Portfolios with less than 5% of the total value are also grouped in the pie chart.

title: View customer details
body: SCREENSHOT OF CUSTOMER DETAILS

title: Access FA Client Portal
body: To access a view-only version of a customer's FA Client Portal profile, click ICON in the Actions column. You cannot make changes to the customer's FA Client Portal in this version.

title: View and manage notes and documents
body: The Notes section in Customer details allows you to view and modify notes, background information, and documents related to the customer.

title: View and edit customer info
body: You can view and edit text in the Customer info tab. Use the Edit button to modify the notes.

title: View and manage documents
body: You can see documents uploaded for the customer in the Documents tab of the Notes section. The documents are grouped by document category (see Preference - Tags to configure document categories in FA Back).

title: View and manage documents
body: To delete or download documents to your device, select the desired documents and click the Delete or Download button.

title: View and manage documents
body: To add documents, click Upload and choose the document category and signing status. You can upload multiple documents at the same time, and the category and signing status is applied to all of them. To make the documents visible to the customer in the FA Client Portal, enable the Show in FA Client Portal option.

title: View and manage documents
body: To edit the document category, signing status, or availability in FA Client Portal, click in the Actions column.

title: View and manage documents
body: SCREENSHOT OF DOCUMENTS TAB

title: View and manage documents
body: The following columns are shown for each document:

title: View and manage documents
body: Group

title: View and manage documents
body: The category of the document, for example, agreement or investment plan. Document categories are configured in FA Back (Preference, Document tags).

title: View and manage documents
body: Document name

title: View and manage documents
body: The name of the document and its file extension, for example, PDF or XLSX.

title: View and manage documents
body: Uploaded by

title: View and manage documents
body: The username of the user who uploaded the document.

title: View and manage documents
body: Upload date

title: View and manage documents
body: The upload date and time of the document.

title: View and manage documents
body: Signing status

title: View and manage documents
body: The signing status of the document, for example, pending or expired. Document signing tags are configured in FA Back (Preference, Document tags). To modify the signing status of a document, the document signing tag needs to be assigned in FA Back (see Managing documents).

title: View and manage documents
body: FA Client Portal

title: View and manage documents
body: The availability of the document in FA Client Portal. To make a document available in the FA Client Portal, it needs to be assigned the "Online" tag in FA Back (see Managing documents).

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: You can see a list of meeting notes in the Meeting notes tab of the Notes section. To view a meeting note, click in the Actions column.

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: To create a new meeting note, click Add meeting note. To delete or download meeting notes to your device as TXT files, select the desired meeting notes and click the Delete or Download button.

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: The following columns are shown for meeting notes:

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: Meeting note name

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: The name of the meeting note.

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: Meeting date

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: The date of the meeting.

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: Author

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: The user who added the meeting note.

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: Modified date

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: The date when the meeting note was modified.

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: Last modified by

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: The user who last modified the meeting note.

title: Add other tabs
body: The Notes section also allows you to add other tabs for your convenience. To create a new tab, use the + Add tab button and enter a name for it in the Note name field. You can then add your notes in the text editor.

title: User access
body: Follow the instructions below to set up access to FA Client Portal:

title: User access
body: Access for end users - Create a user and specify contacts and portfolios the user can access.

title: User access
body: Access for troubleshooting - Set up view-only access to client information for advisors, support service, and so on.

title: Access for end users
body: FA Client Portal provides end clients with access to investment information. The user can access:

title: Access for end users
body: Their own portfolios and subportfolios.

title: Access for end users
body: Portfolios and subportfolios of the contacts the user represents – for example, if the user represents their child or a company they work for. A representative can switch between the contacts in FA Client Portal by clicking .

title: Access for end users
body: To provide access to FA Client Portal, you need to:

title: Access for end users
body: Add a new user as described in Managing users in FA Admin guide. Assign the user CLIENT PORTAL role.

title: Access for end users
body: Set up the user’s access to client information stored in FA Back:

title: Access for end users
body: To let the user access their own investment information, make sure the user's contact is specified as a primary contact for the portfolio (see Contacts) and link this contact to the user in FA Admin console (to do this, follow the steps in Link a contact to the user).

title: Access for end users
body: To let a representative access the linked contacts’ information in FA Client Portal, add the user as the contact’s representative in the Contact window, Representatives tab.

title: Access for troubleshooting
body: Access for troubleshooting

title: Access for troubleshooting
body: View-only mode lets advisors and support service specialists access the same view as the client sees, without being able to make any modifications. To access client accounts in FA Client Portal view-only:

title: Access for troubleshooting
body: Assign your user "CLIENT PORTAL IMPERSONATE" role in FA Admin Console. See Assign user roles for detailed instructions.

title: Access for troubleshooting
body: View FA Client Portal for a contact in the impersonate mode:

title: Access for troubleshooting
body: In FA Back, right-click the contact in the Overview and choose "Impersonate in Client Portal".

title: Access for troubleshooting
body: FA Client Portal opens in a new tab in your browser

title: Enable features for users
body: You can enable or restrict various features in FA Client Portal.

title: Hide subportfolios
body: Hide subportfolios - assign the Client Portal: Hide subportfolio tag to the subportfolio in FA Back

title: Make documents available
body: Make documents available in CP - upload to the security in FA Back (security window, documents) AND add "Online" tag to the documents

title: Make documents available
body: Make prospectus / KIID available in CP - add links to these in FA Back (security window)

title: Enable trading, switching, and canceling trade orders
body: Enable buying and selling - include the portfolio in the CP_TRADING group and add "Tradeable" tag to it in FA Back

title: Enable trading, switching, and canceling trade orders
body: Enable trading - include the portfolio in CP_TRADING group in FA Back

title: Enable trading, switching, and canceling trade orders
body: Enable canceling an order (with Open or Accepted status) - include the portfolio in CP_CANCEL group in FA Back

title: Enable trading, switching, and canceling trade orders
body: Enable switching a fund position to another fund - include the portfolio in CP_TRADING group and add "Switchable" tag to it in FA Back

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Enable deposits and withdrawals - include the portfolio in "CP_DEPOSIT" and/or "CP_WITHDRAWAL" group in FA Back

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: Enable monthly investments - set up investments according to Admin guide, include the portfolios in the CP_MONTHLYINVESTMENTS portfolio group

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: Enable monthly savings - include the portfolios in the CP_MONTHLYSAVINGS group

title: Scheduling
body: You can configure FA processes to run at specific times. The scheduling is done with Cron expressions.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: To create and manage schedules, open Tools → Administer → Scheduled functions in the top menu. After selecting a scheduled process, you can see the Cron schedule specified for it. This means a regular execution time has been set for the process.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: To add a new schedule:

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Click the Add button and fill in the fields:

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Cron schedule

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: The process schedule specified using Cron syntax (see Cron schedules). The next execution time is shown when a valid Cron schedule is entered.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Configuration

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: The configuration used for the schedule.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Saved views

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: The saved view, if it’s relevant for the process you are scheduling. The saved view can be e.g. saved transaction view if you are scheduling a functionality that runs against a list of transactions.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Click Save to save the schedules. Alternatively, you can click Remove to delete a schedule.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Click the Run button to test your configurations. The functionality is run with the configuration set and saved view you specified.

title: Cron schedules
body: The schedules are specified in the Cron syntax. The basic principles are:

title: Cron schedules
body: The schedules are specified in the following order, with space separating each component:

title: Cron schedules
body: Seconds

title: Cron schedules
body: Minutes

title: Cron schedules
body: Hours

title: Cron schedules
body: Day-of-month

title: Cron schedules
body: Month

title: Cron schedules
body: Day-of-week

title: Cron schedules
body: Year (optional)

title: Cron schedules
body: Asterisk ( * ) can be used to specify any value (for example, * as the Day-of-month component indicates that the schedule is run every day of the month).

title: Cron schedules
body: Question mark (?) can be used in day-of-month and day-of-week fields to specify “no specific value”.

title: Cron schedules
body: Some examples of different kinds of schedules:

title: Cron schedules
body: Daily at 15:00:

title: Cron schedules
body: On the first second of the first minute of the 15th hour, every day of month and every month, regardless of the day-of-week

title: Cron schedules
body: Every Friday at 12:30:

title: Cron schedules
body: Every weekday (Monday through Friday) at 08:10:20

title: Cron schedules
body: 20 10 08 ? * MON-FRI

title: Cron schedules
body: On the first day of every month at 21:00

title: FA Advisor user accesses
body: To set up user access to FA Advisor and give a user access to customer data, do the following:

title: FA Advisor user accesses
body: Give a user access to the FA Advisor app by assigning them the correct user role in FA Admin Console, User management view. If you do not have such a role available in the User management view, ask FA to create one for you.

title: FA Advisor user accesses
body: In the FA Admin Console, User management view, link the user to the contact whose portfolios they should be able to view (see Link a contact to the user).

title: FA Advisor user accesses
body: In FA Back, add the user as a representative for the contacts they represent in the Contact window, Representatives tab (see Contact window).

title: Set up access to customer investments in Client Portal
body: A user can access a view-only version of a customer's FA Client Portal in the Customers view. To give a user access, assign the correct role to them. See Assign user roles for detailed instructions.

title: Access for employees
body: To manage the user’s access to client information stored in FA, set up the limited visibility feature. For example, you can let advisors view only the portfolios they are responsible for.

title: Access for employees
body: Limited visibility can be set up:

title: Access for employees
body: For each user by linking the user to the clients they are allowed to access.

title: Access for employees
body: For several users - for example, employees of a company branch. In this case, all users who belong to the branch have access to the data associated with the clients of this branch. Employees of another branch don’t have access to this data. When onboarding a new employee, linking the user to a branch automatically sets up the needed access rights.

title: Access for employees
body: Limited visibility affects the following views and windows:

title: Access for employees
body: The Overview, Customers and Contacts, Portfolios, Transactions, Trade orders, Positions, Market prices and Analytics+ views show only contacts and portfolios available to the user under their limited visibility settings.

title: Access for employees
body: The Groups include only the contacts and portfolios available to the user under their limited visibility settings.

title: Access for employees
body: The Document management view shows only contacts and portfolios, transactions, and trade orders available to the user under their limited visibility settings.

title: Access for employees
body: The Bookkeeping view shows only postings available to the user under their limited visibility settings.

title: Access for employees
body: The Rebalance view shows all rebalances conducted by the user or other users who have the same role(s). These include rebalances on the portfolios hidden from the user under their limited visibility settings. The user can manage all the model portfolios available for them according to their user role.

title: Access for employees
body: The Tasks view shows all tasks in the My tasks, My completed tasks, Tasks assigned to me and Tasks created by me lists. When creating a new task, the Assignee and Owner fields in the Task window feature all users who have at least one common role with the logged-in user.

title: Access for employees
body: The Report window shows only the Generate reports tab.

title: Access for employees
body: Other views aren’t affected by the limited visibility settings. You need to make sure that the user roles assigned to the user don’t allow them to access these views.

title: Install FA Client Portal
body: Install FA Client Portal in FA Back → Tools → Administer → Install Optional Packages → Other packages → FA Client Portal → Install.
