title: User management view
body: The User management view allows you to manage FA platform users and their access rights to applications.

title: User management view
body: <screenshot>

title: Search for users and save the views
body: You can search for the users with filters and sort the search results by clicking on the column titles. For the column descriptions, see User details and account information. You can save the view you created to open it again later (click ). To manage saved views, click .

title: Search for users and save the views
body: To download the user list in the XLXS file, click Export.

title: Search for users and save the views
body: To view and edit user information, click a user in the list – the User details pane opens.

title: Add a user
body: To create a user account:

title: Add a user
body: Click Add user at the top-right corner and fill in the user information:

title: Add a user
body: The User ID used as a username at login and Email (required fields).

title: Add a user
body: Linked contact to set up access to client data or access to FA Front access with the external identity provider.

title: Add a user
body: Other fields if needed. See User details and account information for details.

title: Add a user
body: Click Edit user roles in the User details pane and choose which apps your user can access and with what roles.

title: Add a user
body: To access an app, a user needs a role for it – a user without any roles can't access any application.

title: Add a user
body: Let the user know about their credentials and how to get a password.

title: Add a user
body: Send them the user ID – FA platform doesn't send this information automatically.

title: Add a user
body: Instruct the user to request a password reset link by clicking Forgot password on the login page.

title: Deactivate a user
body: If a user doesn't need to access the platform anymore, we recommend deactivating their account rather than deleting it – this maintains the user's history while preventing them from accessing FA.

title: Deactivate a user
body: To change the status for multiple users, choose the users in the list and click . To change the status for one user, click in the User details pane. You can see the user's status in the list of users:

title: Deactivate a user
body: Active – The user can log in to the FA platform.

title: Deactivate a user
body: Inactive – The user can't log in to the FA platform.

title: Delete a user
body: Deleting a user removes all user information from the system. A deleted user can’t log in. If you just want to disable a user and prevent them from logging in, consider deactivating the user instead of deleting the account. To delete a user, click in the User details pane.

title: Assign user roles
body: The Roles block in the User details pane shows the roles assigned to the user. Roles determine:

title: Assign user roles
body: The app the user can access. To access an app, the user needs at least one role within that app. For example, if a user has a right in FA Back, the user is allowed to access FA Back.

title: Assign user roles
body: The access rights within the app. For example, FA Back roles determine access rights through permission and FA Front roles determine access rights through the views defined for the role.

title: Assign user roles
body: To add or remove the user’s roles, click Edit user roles at the top of the User details pane.

title: Manage authentication
body: You can manage user authentication using the following options:

title: Password reset
body: You can force the user to reset their password on next login. To force a password reset for multiple users, choose the users in the list and click . To force password reset for a selected user, click in the User details pane, choose Force password reset on next login and save the changes.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Two-factor authentication is a login option that requires entering a verification code in addition to the basic credentials (user ID and password). You can check two-factor authentication status in the User details pane:

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Disabled – Two-factor authentication is turned off.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Enabled – Two-factor authentication is turned on. The user has logged in and completed the mobile authenticator setup.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Pending – Two-factor authentication is turned on. You chose “Enable two-factor authentication on next login”, but the user didn’t yet log in to complete the setup.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: To manage two-factor authentication, use the buttons (available depending on the two-factor authentication status):

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Enable two-factor authentication

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Enable two-factor authentication on the next login for the user.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Cancel two-factor authentication

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Cancel two-factor authentication request that is pending.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Disable two-factor authentication

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Disable two-factor authentication for the user.

title: Brute force detection
body: FA Platform uses brute force detection to identify attempts to guess a user’s password. Brute force detection temporarily disables the user's account after a certain number and frequency of login failures. The user account is disabled for one minute if:

title: Brute force detection
body: The user enters incorrect credentials twice within a second. This means that someone tries to guess the password programmatically.

title: Brute force detection
body: The user fails to enter correct credentials 5 times. After the account is disabled, every unsuccessful attempt increases the lock by one minute, up to one hour.

title: Brute force detection
body: To check if a user account is disabled by the brute force detection, open the User details pane and go to the Brute force detection section. It includes the following information:

title: Brute force detection
body: Status

title: Brute force detection
body: Brute force detection status of the user account: Blocked (deactivated by brute force detection), or Unblocked (active). A user blocked by brute force detection has to wait for up to 1 hour (depending on the number of unsuccessful login attempts) for the account to be unblocked.

title: Brute force detection
body: Total login attempts

title: Brute force detection
body: The number of failed login attempts.

title: Brute force detection
body: Last attempt

title: Brute force detection
body: The date and time of the last login attempt.

title: Brute force detection
body: IP address

title: Brute force detection
body: The IP address from which the last login attempt was made.

title: Brute force detection
body: To activate a blocked user account, choose Unblock and activate. Once unblocked, your user can log in again without waiting for the system to unblock the user after a certain time.

title: User details and account information
body: The list of users and the User details pane on the right show the following information:

title: User account information
body: User ID (required)

title: User account information
body: A unique user ID for logging in to FA and log the user's activities.

title: User account information
body: Email (required)

title: User account information
body: The user’s email to send a password reset link to the user, if the user clicks Forgot password on the login page.

title: User account information
body: First name, Last name

title: User account information
body: The user’s first and last name.

title: User account information
body: Linked contact

title: User account information
body: The corresponding contact in FA Back. Linked contact is needed to:

title: User account information
body: Grant access only to certain customers and portfolios (see the Set up limited visibility for one user and Set up limited visibility for many users sections in the FA Admin guide).

title: User account information
body: Allow online end users to view their own investments in FA Front. A user that has a linked contact has access to the investment information associated with this contact.

title: User account information
body: Linked contact external ID

title: User account information
body: The user’s external ID received from the external identity provider when the user logs in to FA Front. External ID is used to find a matching contact for the user. If you see this field, this means that FA failed to link a contact to the user. For example, there is no contact with such an ID or there are several contacts with this ID stored in FA. In this case, you can add a contact manually in the Linked contact field.

title: User account information
body: Status

title: User account information
body: The user account status: active (the user can log in to FA) or inactive (the user can't log in to the system). See Assign user roles for details.

title: Sessions
body: The Sessions block shows a list of currently active sessions for the user. For example, the same user might have logged in with different browsers, having multiple sessions open at the same time. The list shows:

title: Sessions
body: Application

title: Sessions
body: The apps where the user is logged in within the session. For example, the user might have FA Back and FA Front open in different tabs in the same browser, accessing both applications with a single login and a single session.

title: Sessions
body: Last access

title: Sessions
body: The date and time the user accessed an app within the session. If the user accesses only one app, this shows the time they logged in, or if your user accesses multiple apps, this shows the time the user last opened a new app.

title: Sessions
body: IP address

title: Sessions
body: Shows the IP address the user is logged in from.

title: Sessions
body: You can log the user out of all sessions by clicking Log out user from all sessions. The user will be able to use FA for a short time until their authentication expires, then they will get a "communication problem" and will be taken to the login page.

title: Last logins
body: The Last logins block shows date and time of the five last user logins.

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: # Code Required Name Description

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 1 pd.endDate Yes End date The end date of the period for which the TWR values are valid. The format is YYYY-MM-dd.

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 2 pd.twr Yes TWR TWR over the period. Use a dot as a decimal separator, for example: 0.00995.

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 3 pd.twrFx No TWR (fx) TWR (fx) over the period. Use a dot as a decimal separator, for example: 0.00995. The default value is 0.

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 4 pd.twrGross No TWR Gross TWR Gross over the period. Use a dot as a decimal separator, for example: 0.00995. The default value is 0.

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 5 pd.marketValueEnd Yes Market value Market value. Use a dot as a decimal separator, for example: 0.00995.

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 6 pd.cashflow No Net cashflow Net cashflow over the period. Use a dot as a decimal separator, for example: 0.00995. The default value is 0.

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 7 pd.currency No Currency The return currency. Enter the currency code. By default, portfolio currency is used.

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 8 pd.identifier Yes Porfolio ID Portfolio ID of the portfolio analysed (see the description of the pd.scope field).

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 9 pd.scope No Scope The scope of analysis. Currently, only one option is available: PORTFOLIO – import TWR values for a certain portfolio. The default value is "portfolio".

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 10 pd.groupingCode Yes Code The code of the portfolio, security, security type that is used for grouping in the pd.grouping field. Use a comma as a separator.

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 11 pd.grouping Yes Grouping Grouping used for the analysis. For example, you can upload the data grouped by portfolio, security, or security type. For the full list of grouping options, see Analytics+ grouping options in FA Developer guide.

title: Performance calculation
body: Cashflow timing Description

title: Performance calculation
body: Differentiated (default) The daily market value-based TWR formula Positive net cashflows are added to the base for long positions. Negative cashflows are added to the base only for short positions. In other cases, negative cashflows are handled at the end of the day. The absolute value of the result is taken. DailyTWR=UnrealizedProfit+RealizedProfit+OtherProfits-OtherCosts|MarketValueStart+PositiveNetCashflow|-1DailyTWR=\frac{Unrealized\Pr ofit+Realized\Pr ofit+Other\Pr ofits-OtherCosts}{|MarketValueStart+PositiveNetCashflow|}-1 The daily exposure-based TWR formula Positive net exposure is added to the base for long positions. Negative exposure is added to the base only for short positions. In other cases, negative exposure is handled at the end of the day. The absolute value of the result is taken. DailyTWR=UnrealizedProfit+RealizedProfit+OtherProfits-OtherCosts|ExposureStart+PositiveNetExposure|-1DailyTWR=\frac{Unrealized\Pr ofit+Realized\Pr ofit+Other\Pr ofits-OtherCosts}{|ExposureStart+PositiveNetExposure|}-1

title: Performance calculation
body: Start of day The daily market value-based TWR formula The net of positive and negative net cashflows is added to the base. The absolute value of the result is taken. DailyTWR=UnrealizedProfits+RealizedProfits+OtherProfits-OtherCosts|MarketValueStart+(PositiveNetCashflow-NegativeNetCashflow)|-1DailyTWR=\frac{Unrealized\Pr ofits+Realized\Pr ofits+Other\Pr ofits-OtherCosts}{|MarketValueStart+\left(PositiveNetCashflow-NegativeNetCashflow\right)|}-1 The daily exposure-based TWR formula The net of positive and negative exposure is added to the base. The absolute value of the result is taken. DailyTWR=UnrealizedProfits+RealizedProfits+OtherProfits-OtherCosts|ExposureStart+(PositiveNetExposure-NegativeNetExposure)|-1DailyTWR=\frac{Unrealized\Pr ofits+Realized\Pr ofits+Other\Pr ofits-OtherCosts}{|ExposureStart+\left(PositiveNetExposure-NegativeNetExposure\right)|}-1

title: Performance calculation
body: End of day The daily market value-based TWR formula The net of positive and negative net cashflows are handled at the end of the day. This means they affect the market value base of the next day. The base is always market value start. The absolute value of the result is taken. DailyTWR=UnrealizedProfits+RealizedProfits+OtherProfits-OtherCosts|MarketValueStart|-1DailyTWR=\frac{Unrealized\Pr ofits+Realized\Pr ofits+Other\Pr ofits-OtherCosts}{|MarketValueStart|}-1 The daily exposure-based TWR formula The net of positive and negative exposure is handled at the end of the day. This means it affects the market value base of the next day. The base exposure start. The absolute value of the result is taken. DailyTWR=UnrealizedProfits+RealizedProfits+OtherProfits-OtherCosts|ExposureStart|-1DailyTWR=\frac{Unrealized\Pr ofits+Realized\Pr ofits+Other\Pr ofits-OtherCosts}{|ExposureStart|}-1

title: Performance calculation
body: Simple Dietz The daily market value-based TWR formula Positive and negative net cashflows are handled in the middle of the day. Half of the net of positive and negative net cashflows is added to the base. The absolute value of the result is taken. DailyTWR=UnrealizedProfits+RealizedProfits+otherProfits-otherCosts∣MarketValueStart+PositiveNetCashflow-NegativeNetCashflow2∣-1DailyTWR=\frac{Unrealized\Pr ofits+Realized\Pr ofits+other\Pr ofits-otherCosts}{∣MarketValueStart+\frac{PositiveNetCashflow-NegativeNetCashflow}{2}∣}-1 The daily exposure-based TWR formula Positive and negative net exposure is handled in the middle of the day. Half of the net of positive and negative net exposure is added to the base. The absolute value of the result is taken. DailyTWR=UnrealizedProfits+RealizedProfits+otherProfits-otherCosts∣ExposureStart+PositiveNetExposure-NegativeNetExposure2∣-1DailyTWR=\frac{Unrealized\Pr ofits+Realized\Pr ofits+other\Pr ofits-otherCosts}{∣ExposureStart+\frac{PositiveNetExposure-NegativeNetExposure}{2}∣}-1

title: General
body: Preference Description

title: General
body: Posting generation

title: General
body: Choose the action on transaction saving Option to choose if postings are generated on transaction save: Always generate postings when saving a transactionThe system automatically generates postings every time you save a transaction.Ask the user if postings should be generatedThe system asks you to choose if postings should be generated when you save a transaction.Never generate postings when saving a transactionThe system never generates postings when you save a transaction.

title: General
body: Generate zero-amount postings Option to generate postings when the posting amount is zero.

title: General
body: Tag for transactions that generate no postings Tag to apply to transactions to skip the generation of postings.

title: General
body: Posting rules

title: General
body: Generate postings in the portfolio currency Option to use only specific posting rules to generate postings in the portfolio currency. By default, all posting rules are applied to generate postings, and postings are created in the portfolio currency.

title: General
body: Posting rule codes to generate postings in the portfolio currency Posting rules to generate postings in the portfolio currency. Applied to all if empty. Specify the posting rule codes as a comma-separated list. You also need to add the rules to the portfolio in the Portfolio window, Posting rule field.

title: General
body: Generate postings in the security currency Option to generate some postings in the security currency instead of the portfolio currency.

title: General
body: Posting rule codes to generate postings in the security currency Posting rules to generate postings in the security currency. Applied to all if empty. Specify the posting rule codes as a comma-separated list. You also need to add the rules to the portfolio in the Portfolio window, Posting rule field.

title: General
body: Generate postings in the account currency Option to generate some postings in the currency of the security related to the transaction instead of the portfolio currency. Only unique currency postings are generated.

title: General
body: Posting rule codes to generate postings in the account currency Posting rules to generate postings in the account currency. Applied to all if empty. Specify the posting rule codes as a comma-separated list. You also need to add the rules to the portfolio in the Portfolio window, Posting rule field.

title: General
body: Currency codes to generate postings in other currencies Currencies other than the account currency in which postings should be generated. Specify the currency codes as a comma-separated list.

title: General
body: Posting rule codes to generate postings in other currencies Posting rules to generate postings in other currencies. Applied to all if empty. Specify the posting rule codes as a comma-separated list. You also need to add the rules to the portfolio in the Portfolio window, Posting rule field.

title: General
body: Use currency posting rules for security-based transactions with accounts not in the portfolio currency Option to generate separate postings for currency exchange if the security sell or buy is made against an account with a currency different from the portfolio currency. If you enable this option, create posting rules against the currency security type with transaction types buy and sell.

title: General
body: Posting amount

title: General
body: Security type codes that get the purchase value from the cash account purchase price (default: “CASH, FUTCF”) Securities that take the purchase value from the average purchase price of cash in the booked account. This setting is needed if the purchase value and profit are to be booked on cash-type transactions. By default, this is cash (CASH) and future cashflows (FUTCF). Specify the security codes as a comma-separated list.

title: General
body: Use book values for calculating FX profit and loss Option to use the book FX values in currency profit and loss calculation.

title: General
body: Apply rounding before calculating the posting amount Option to round posting charge amounts individually before the total amount is saved for the posting. If you disable this option, rounding is applied to the total posting amount.

title: General
body: Disable the netting of postings Option to disable the netting of postings. Netting means that if a transaction generates multiple postings against the same bookkeeping account for the same date, they are summed up and only one posting is saved. If you disable this option, each posting rule generates a separate posting. As a result, a single transaction can have multiple postings against the same account on the same day.

title: General
body: Posting accounts

title: General
body: Bookkeeping account numbers per currency to use ACC account postings if the portfolio secondary account number is undefined (for example “SEK=1921,EUR=1922”) Bookkeeping account numbers per currency to use ACC account postings if the portfolio secondary account number is undefined. Format: “Currency code=Account number”. For example, “SEK=1921,EUR=1922”.

title: General
body: Use these accounts also when the bookkeeping account code is ACC and the portfolio’s secondary account number is defined Option to always use the specified account numbers for ACC accounts, even if the portfolio secondary account number is defined.

title: Available charge types
body: Charge type Description

title: Available charge types
body: Price Corresponds with the calculated price shown in the transaction window, e.g. amount * unit price.

title: Available charge types
body: Purchase price (no cost) Takes into account the purchase price, without costs, associated with the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Total tax Corresponds with the sum of the values in the tax fields of the transaction, e.g. tax 1 and tax 2 together.

title: Available charge types
body: Accrued interest Corresponds with the value in the Accrued interest field of the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Total price Corresponds with the total trade amount of the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Credit fee Corresponds with the value in the Credit fee field of the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Fee Corresponds with the value in the Fee field of the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Purchase price Takes into account the purchase price associated with the transaction. If booked values are defined, then those are taken into account.

title: Available charge types
body: Loss Takes into account the loss induced by the transaction (calculated from booked values if they have been defined).

title: Available charge types
body: Profit Takes into account the profit induced by the transaction (calculated from booked values if they have been defined).

title: Available charge types
body: Currency loss Takes into account the currency loss induced by the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Currency profit Takes into account the currency profit induced by the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Loss (no cost) Takes into account the loss, calculated without taking into account costs, induced by the transaction (calculated from booked values if they have been defined).

title: Available charge types
body: Profit (no cost) Takes into account the profit, calculated without taking into account costs, induced by the transaction (calculated from booked values if they have been defined).

title: Available charge types
body: Tax 1 Corresponds with the value in the Tax 1 field of the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Tax 2 Corresponds with the value in the Tax 2 field of the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Purchase price (orig.) Takes into account the original purchase price associated with the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Accrued interest (purch.) Takes into account the accrued interest associated with the purchase transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Nominal value Corresponds with the amount field of the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Tax types See a list of tax types defined in Taxation preferences. This type takes into account the sum of values of the tax fields with the checked tax type.

title: Key figures
body: Key figure Description

title: Key figures
body: Collateral value The collateral value of a portfolio position, calculated by multiplying the market value and collateral ratio of the security.

title: Key figures
body: Available credit The amount of portfolio credit available for the client to use.

title: Key figures
body: Used credit The amount of portfolio credit already used by the client.

title: Key figures

title: Schedules tab
body: Convention Description

title: Schedules tab
body: Following Move to the next valid business day.

title: Schedules tab
body: Modified following (without crossing mid-month or month end) Move to the next valid business day, unless that is after the 15th of the month OR in the next month in which case move to the previous valid business day.

title: Schedules tab
body: Modified following (without crossing month end) Move to the next valid business day, unless that is in the next month in which case move to the previous valid business day.

title: Schedules tab
body: Modified preceding (without crossing month start) Move to the previous valid business day, unless that is in the previous month in which case move to the next valid business day.

title: Schedules tab
body: Nearest For Sunday and Monday, move to the next valid business day, for all other days, move to the previous valid business day.

title: Schedules tab
body: No adjustment Make no adjustment.

title: Schedules tab
body: Preceeding Move to the previous valid business day.
